translated: Michaelsson, Karl Magnus Hjalmar, professor of Romance languages, Gothenburg, born on June 23, 1890 in Sthilim of apiol. Divorced. Parents: M. and Sofda P. Siblings: Kanin born in 1918, Mairii^anine in 1923, Erik in 1926, Magnus in 1928. Education: Primary school in northern S'thil(m until 1909, completed secondary school in Uppsala in 1914, attended university there from 1921, obtained a PhD in 1928, studied at Sorbonne and Ecole des Hautes Etudes in Paris from 1921-1922, professor at Uppsala from 1928. Taught Romance languages at Uppsala University from 1927-1930, at Gothenburg University from 1930, and was acting professor of Romance languages there from 1935-1937, and then became a professor in 1937. Teaching experience: Student teacher in Uppsala from 1915-1918, teacher at Uppsala folk high school in 1920-1921, Latin teacher at Uppsala Enskilda Grammar School in 1917-1918 and 1928-1930, principal of Gothenburg's Latin grammar school in 1929, teacher and examiner in French at Gothenburg's higher commercial school from 1930, headteacher in French and Spanish at Gothenburg's Handelsinstitut, appointed in 1931. Member of Alliance Française in Uppsala from 1915-1930, chairman of Värmland's national society in Uppsala from 1921, secretary of Göteborg's Latin Society, Christian section, from 1934, chairman from 1939-1941, chairman of the Filological Society in Gothenburg from 1941-1947, chairman of the Alliance Française in Gothenburg from 1945, inspector of the Kungälv municipal chamber choir from 1937, member of the student council from 1938. Publications: The Passage of R in French (1924), Egidius Gilles, a Biomorphic Study (1925), Studies on the Personal Names of French Individuals according to the Parisian Tax Rolls I-II (1927-1936), How Surnames Arise and Gain Recognition (1931), How Personal Names Evolve into Appellatives (1935), French La Folie, Swedish Vanity (1937), The Clarity of the French Language (1939), Ambiance (1939), The French Language (1944), Selections from Paris University's Medieval History (1944), Some Aspects of Contemporary French (1947), numerous articles in newspapers and magazines, mostly about French literature and culture, as well as pedagogical issues, translations from English and French. Honors: Royal Norwegian Order, Order of the French Legion of Honor, Royal Swedish Academy of Letters, History and Antiquities (chairman in 1947).
